thread.title: From Jerusalem to NYC: Boris Johnson & David Cameron’s globetrotting dinner dates continue
thread.title_full: From Jerusalem to NYC: Boris Johnson & David Cameron’s globetrotting dinner dates continue

author: RT
title: From Jerusalem to NYC: Boris Johnson & David Cameron’s globetrotting dinner dates continue
text:
From Jerusalem to NYC: Boris Johnson & David Cameron’s globetrotting dinner dates continue  13 Get short URL Boris Johnson and David Cameron © Stefan Rousseau / Reuters After settling their Brexit differences over whiskeys in Jerusalem last year, David Cameron and Boris Johnson have been spotted together again – this time ‘dad dancing’ in New York City. Read more Boris & Cameron settle Brexit feud over whiskey in Jerusalem… freezing out ‘backstabber’ Gove 
After a very public falling-out over the EU referendum, the ex-PM and foreign secretary’s friendship is clearly back on track. Their 30-year association came under strain when Johnson abandoned Cameron’s campaign to keep Britain in the EU, opting instead to lead the charge for the opposing side. 
The politicians, who have known each other since their days at Oxford University, exchanged personal insults during their referendum campaign. They were members of the notorious Bullingdon Club, the elite dining clique founded over 200 years ago which is known for its hard drinking and bad behavior, including vandalizing restaurants. 
The result of the EU referendum ended Cameron’s six-year tenure at Downing Street and 10 years as the Conservative Party’s leader.On Thursday night, the pair were photographed on the streets of Harlem, NYC, after dining together at the popular Red Rooster restaurant. 
Joanna Geary, who works for Twitter, posted photographs of the old friends as they left the restaurant. 
“I hadn’t seen David until Boris said, ‘I suspect you’ll recognize my friend David,’ and pointed in his direction,” she said. Boris and David dining together in Harlem: pic.twitter.com/u48tsmBZ1b — Joanna Geary ⚡️ (@JoannaG) March 24, 2017 
Geary told the Guardian she spoke to another diner in the restaurant, who said: “Everyone realized they were important but had no idea who they were … They were just bopping along to the music like the rest of us.” 
Geary asked if they were ‘dad dancing,’ to which the diner laughed and replied, “That’s about the size of it.” — Joanna Geary ⚡️ (@JoannaG) March 24, 2017 
Cameron is on a speaking tour in the US and Johnson arrived earlier this week to attend a counter-terrorism conference. 
Cameron and Johnson are believed to have brokered a truce in October last year, when they met on the balcony of a room at the five-star King David Hotel in Jerusalem. They reportedly hashed out their differences over whiskeys.
